info.title: DNSRadar API
info.description: DNSRadar API - Monitor your DNS records and get notified when they change.

ApiKeyAuth.name: X-Api-Key
ApiKeyAuth.description: API key used to authenticate yourself on DNSRadar. Obtain your API key from your DNSRadar dashboard.

PaginatedResponse.description: Paginated response wrapper for list endpoints. Uses cursor-based pagination with after/before parameters.

after.description: Cursor to fetch the next page of results

before.description: Cursor to fetch the previous page of results

has_more.description: Indicates if there are more items to fetch

data.description: Array of items for the current page

avatar.description: URL to the user's avatar image

is_owner.description: Whether this account is the organization owner

created.description: Account creation datetime in ISO 8601 format

locked.description: Account lock datetime in ISO 8601 format, if locked

lock_reason.description: Reason for account lock. Ban means the account was banned by an admin. Email means the account is new and the user has not verified their email address. Bounced means emails to the user have bounced.

has_newsletter.description: Whether the user is subscribed to the newsletter

is_premium.description: Whether organization has an active subscription

created.description: Monitor creation datetime in ISO 8601 format

subdomain.description: Subdomain to monitor (empty string for apex)

is_exact_match.description: If set to false, special rules applies depending on the record_type. See documentation for details.

last_checked.description: Datetime of the last check in ISO 8601 format

Event.description: DNS change event detected by monitoring

subdomain.description: Subdomain to monitor (empty string for apex)

occurred.description: Datetime when the event occurred in ISO 8601 format

incidence_count.description: Total number of incidents for the monitor.

is_default.description: Whether this is the default group

created.description: Webhook creation datetime in ISO 8601 format

method.description: HTTP method to use for the webhook

headers.description: Custom HTTP headers as key-value pairs

secret.description: Secret key used for HMAC-SHA256 signing of webhook requests. The signature is sent in the X-Webhook-Signature header.

last_executed.description: Datetime of last execution in ISO 8601 format

created.description: Datetime when the webhook request was created in ISO 8601 format

delivered.description: Datetime when the webhook was successfully delivered in ISO 8601 format

status_code.description: HTTP status code from the last delivery attempt

response_body.description: Response body from the last delivery attempt (truncated to 4000 chars)

last_attempt.description: Datetime when the webhook was sent for the last time, in ISO 8601 format

PaginationAfter.name: after
PaginationAfter.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results. Use the value from the previous response's 'after' field.

PaginationBefore.name: before
PaginationBefore.description: Cursor for fetching the previous page of results. Use the value from the previous response's 'before' field.

PaginationLimit.name: limit
PaginationLimit.description: Number of items per page (1-100, default: 20)

get.description: Get a paginated list of all team members in the organization.
Get details of the organization that manages the API key.
Get a paginated list of all DNS monitors for the organization.

x-mint.content:
You can filter monitors by group, state, domain, record_type and is_active.
For example: ?group=production&state=invalid&is_active=true

post.description: Create a new DNS monitor. Rate limited to 250 requests per minutes.

x-mint.content:
Please note that the free plan limited to 50 total monitors.
If you plan to add many monitors, consider using the bulk endpoint `/monitors/bulk` instead.

expected_value.description: Expected DNS value(s). Can be a string or array (max 10 values, each max 1000 chars)

is_exact_match.description: If false, additional values beyond expected_value are allowed

post.description: Create up to 1000 monitors in a single request. Rate limited to 250 requests per minutes.

x-mint.content:
Useful for initial bulk imports, this allows you to import up to 250 000 monitors per minutes.
Please note that the free plan limited to 50 total monitors.

group.description: Default group slug for all monitors

frequency.description: Default frequency for all monitors (in minutes)

get.description: Get details of a specific monitor by UUID.

x-mint.content:
Allows you to update a monitor to adjust to your specific needs.
You can update one or more fields of the monitor, and fields not included in the request body will remain unchanged.
Enabling a monitor will resume its DNS checks according to its configured frequency.

Disabling a monitor will stop its DNS checks until it is re-enabled.
Can be useful if a DNS entry has been temporarily changed or is having issues, to avoid unecessary noise.

get.description: Get a paginated list of DNS changes (as events) detected for a specific monitor.

x-mint.content:
An events is recorded each time a DNS change is detected for the monitor or when a monitor stays on an invalid state. In that last case, the `incidence_count` increases and triggers an event.

You can filter the events by either `occurred_before` or `occurred_after`, as UTC Timestamps.
You can use the pagination parameters to navigate through the list of events.

parameters.name: occurred_before
parameters.description: Filter events that occurred before this UTC timestamp

parameters.name: occurred_after
parameters.description: Filter events that occurred after this UTC timestamp

get.description: Get details of a specific event.
Get a paginated list of all groups.

x-mint.content:
Groups help you organize your monitors into logical collections for easier management and reporting.
You can filter monitors by group using the `group` query parameter on the `/monitors` endpoint.
A default group is automatically created and cannot be removed, but can be renamed. This is required in order to attach a monitor to a group that will be used to send Webhook notifications.

You can create multiple groups to organize your monitors effectively.
Each group must have a unique slug.
You can create unlimited groups on all plans.

slug.description: URL-friendly identifier for the group (auto-generated from name if not provided)

get.description: Get details of a specific group by its slug.

x-mint.content:
The group slug is a URL-friendly identifier for the group.
You can use this slug to filter monitors by group using the `group` query parameter on the `/monitors` endpoint.

patch.description: Update a group's name and/or slug.

x-mint.content:
You can update a group's name and/or slug.
You can pass only the fields you want to update; other fields will remain unchanged.Changing the slug will affect how you reference the group in API calls.

patch.description: Update all monitors in a group with the same settings.

x-mint.content:
This endpoint allows you to update the frequency and active status of all monitors within a specified group in a single request.
Useful for quickly adjusting settings for multiple monitors without having to update each one individually.

get.description: Get a paginated list of all webhooks for the organization.

x-mint.content:
You can filter webhooks by their active status using the `is_active` query parameter.
For example: ?is_active=true

post.description: Create a new webhook for receiving event notifications.

x-mint.content:
By default, an organization is limited to have 5 webhooks per group.
If you need more webhooks, feel free to contact us and explain your needs, and we'll update your limits accordingly

url.description: Webhook endpoint URL (must not resolve to private/loopback IPs)

secret.description: Secret key for HMAC-SHA256 signing of webhook requests

groups.description: Array of group slugs to associate with (created if don't exist)

get.description: Get details of a specific webhook.

x-mint.content:
Allows you to change the webhook's settings to adapt to your needs.
You can update one or more fields of the webhook, and fields not included in the request body will remain unchanged.Changing the header field will completely replace the existing headers; it will not merge them.

secret.description: Secret key for HMAC-SHA256 signing of webhook requests

post.description: Send a test payload to the webhook endpoint.

x-mint.content:
This endpoint allows you to send a test payload to your webhook URL to verify that it is set up correctly and can receive notifications.
The test payload simulates a webhook event, allowing you to check the integration without waiting for an actual event to occur.
Tests are limited to 5 per minutes, and 50 per hours to avoid any abuses.

get.description: Get a paginated list of webhook execution requests.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Filter requests created before this UTC timestamp

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Filter requests created after this UTC timestamp

parameters.name: delivered_before
parameters.description: Filter requests delivered before this UTC timestamp

parameters.name: delivered_after
parameters.description: Filter requests delivered after this UTC timestamp

parameters.name: last_attempt_before
parameters.description: Filter requests with last attempt before this UTC timestamp

parameters.name: last_attempt_after
parameters.description: Filter requests with last attempt after this UTC timestamp

post.description: Enable a disabled webhook and clear any errors.

x-mint.content:
Enabling a webhook will resume sending notifications to the specified URL according to its configuration.
If the webhook was previously disabled due to errors, enabling it will also clear those errors and allow notifications to be sent again.If a webhook has been automatically disabled due to repeated failures, the next enable attempt will not reset the failure count. If an error occurs again, the failure count will continue where it stopped.
So ensure the webhook is working fine before re-enabling it to avoid longer wait.

post.description: Disable a webhook to stop receiving notifications.

x-mint.content:
Disabling a webhook will stop all notifications from being sent to the specified URL until it is re-enabled.
Can be useful if the endpoint is temporarily unavailable or if you want to pause notifications for any reason.

post.description: Retry a failed webhook request delivery.

x-mint.content:
This endpoint allows you to retry the delivery of a specific webhook request that have failed previously.
Upon calling this endpoint, the system will attempt to resend the webhook payload to the original URL using the same method and headers as before.
This is useful for recovering from temporary issues that may have caused the initial delivery to fail.We only allow to retry once every 30 seconds to avoid any abuses.

tags.name: Organization
tags.description: Organization settings, billing, and subscription management
